COMPLIANT: File integrity monitoring and alerting configured for audit logs.
System demonstrates compliance through:
1. File Integrity Monitoring (FIM) Implementation: - FIM tool installed and configured (AIDE/Tripwire/OSSEC detected) - All audit log locations monitored (automated checks verified) - Log file protection enabled (immutable/append-only attributes) - Auditd watch rules configured for log directories
2. Real-Time Alerting Configuration: - FIM alerts configured for unauthorized log modifications - ISSO/SA notification mechanisms tested and verified - SIEM integration active (Splunk/QRadar/ArcSight) - Alert thresholds properly calibrated
3. Organizational Integration: - Documented response procedures for log tampering alerts - 24/7 SOC monitoring of FIM alerts - Incident response procedures include log tampering scenarios - Periodic testing of alerting mechanisms (quarterly minimum)
VERIFICATION EVIDENCE: - FIM configuration files with log directory monitoring rules - Alert test results showing ISSO/SA notification < 5 minutes - SIEM integration documentation with log tampering event correlation - Incident response procedure documentation - Auditd watch rules for /var/log directories
This system meets DoD requirements for immediate alerting on unauthorized audit log changes.

REMEDIATION REQUIRED: Implement file integrity monitoring and alerting for audit logs.
Steps to achieve compliance:
1. Implement File Integrity Monitoring (FIM): - Install FIM tool: apt install aide (recommended for Debian) - Initialize AIDE database: aideinit - Configure AIDE to monitor ALL audit log locations: * /var/log/xo-server/ * /var/log/nginx/ * /var/log/journal/ * /var/log/audit/ - Edit /etc/aide/aide.conf and add: /var/log/xo-server p+i+n+u+g+s+m+c+sha256 /var/log/nginx p+i+n+u+g+s+m+c+sha256 - Set monitoring frequency: Configure cron job for hourly checks
2. Implement Log File Protection: - Set append-only attribute: chattr +a /var/log/xo-server/*.log - Verify immutability: lsattr /var/log/xo-server/ - Configure auditd watch rules: echo "-w /var/log/xo-server/ -p wa -k log_tampering" >> /etc/audit/rules.d/log-monitoring.rules echo "-w /var/log/nginx/ -p wa -k log_tampering" >> /etc/audit/rules.d/log-monitoring.rules - Reload auditd: augenrules --load
3. Configure Real-Time Alerting: - Configure AIDE email notifications in /etc/aide/aide.conf - Install mail utilities: apt install mailutils - Configure SIEM integration for auditd events (syslog forwarding) - Set alert thresholds for unauthorized modifications - Configure /etc/rsyslog.conf for remote logging: *.* @@siem.organization.mil:514
4. Test Alerting Mechanism: - Simulate log tampering: touch /var/log/xo-server/test.log - Verify AIDE detection: aide --check - Verify ISSO/SA receives alert within 5 minutes - Document test results
5. Document and Integrate: - Create incident response procedures for log tampering - Include in organizational security monitoring processes - Schedule quarterly testing of alerting mechanisms - Brief ISSO/SA on alert handling procedures
VERIFICATION EVIDENCE REQUIRED: - FIM configuration files showing log directory monitoring - Alert configuration files with ISSO/SA contact information - SIEM integration documentation (syslog forwarding rules) - Alert test results (simulated tampering with verified ISSO notification) - Incident response procedures for log tampering events - Quarterly testing schedule and results
DoD Requirement: Immediate alerting to security personnel when audit logs are modified without authorization.
